title: Foghat - Live 1977 & King Biscuit Flower Hour 1974/ 76 - 2CD
description:
Here's a chance to party . . .



CD 1 / Foghat Live / 1977:

Foghat Live is Foghat'sbest selling album. A tight set that flows effortlessly and showcases the group's strengths in the best possible light. Everything is delivered with an energy and intensity that would be impossible to capture in a studio. One of Foghat's finest albums because it cherry picks all the highlights of the band's catalog to that point, a gem of 1970s hard rock.

Tracklist / CD 1:

1	Fool For The City	
2	Home In My Hand	
3	I Just Want To Make Love To You	
4	Road Fever	
5	Honey Hush	
6	Slow Ride	

Recorded live at the War Memorial, Rochester, NY, 1977



CD 2 / King Buiscuit Flower Hour: Foghat in Concert 1974 / 76:

Recorded in 1976, with bonus tracks taken from a 1974 concert, King Biscuit Flower Hour: In Concert is quite possibly the best live Foghat album on the market - it boasts better sound quality and lengthier jams than the Foghat Live album from 1977. An awesome show, and the band is on fire.

Tracklist / Disc 2:

1. Fool For The City 
2. My Babe 
3. Drivin' Wheel 
4. Honey Hush 
5. Night Shift 
6. Slow Ride 
7. Home In My Hand (1974 Bonus Track) 
8. Eight Days On The Road (1974 Bonus Track) 
9. Leavin' Again (Again) (1974 Bonus Track) 
10. I Just Want To Make Love To You (1974 Bonus Track) 

Recorded live at the Coliseum, New Haven, CT, 1974 and The Spectrum, Philadelphia, PA, 1976

Note: Music only, no interview.



Foghat:

Lonesome Dave Peverett - Lead Vocals & Guitar

Rod Price - Lead Guitar, Slide Guitar & Vocals

Tony Stevens - Bass & Vocals

Craig MacGregor - Bass & Vocals
